content.description: Emeralds, Grand Wall in the Middle Gorge. This is a 35 meter pitch to top of wall. Start on big ledge, climb through bulgy roof and up blocky face to a blunt arete to chains .11b. Or continue past chains (crux) up onto headwall .12a. Climb good edges to anchor. Need a 70 meter rope to skip midpoint belay and reach the ground.

This route climbs a column/arete for 40' then at a good stance you start the crux up the headwall. Route continues up and left. There are anchors at the top of this climb but you can also traverse left to the top anchors of on the adjacent climb to the left.
content.protection: All bolts with Mussys (Can't Bamember the exact bolt count but somewhere around 17) (Make a comment to correct this)
content.location: This climb starts directly across from Moncho Man

content.description: Start i shallow corner right of big block. Climb up and left through bulge and face above. Finish through small roof.
content.location: Right side of Wishing Well looking up gorge.

content.description: Climb flake then venture onto face through a series of power lie backs. Climb through roof.
A cruxy start leads to fun face climbing through roofs and bulging headwall.
content.location: Start off ledge. Left side of Gorge looking up stream.

content.description: A bouldery traverse leads to a series of power underclings. The crux is pulling onto the headwall.
content.location: Starts on right side of Wishing Well off giant block.

content.description:
Climb the middle section of bolts on the south side of the Upper Wall, up through some blocks and another interesting crimp and edge moves.

The crux is located right after the second bolt, and the rock that this bolt is into seems hollow or possibly loose, so it's probably not a great place to fall.

This route feels like climbing in a gym, and shares the top anchors with Dam It (5.11b) and High and Dry (5.10a).
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor.To set up a top rope, walk around to the top of the climb on the gorge edge above.

content.description: Down low you will climb through a right facing dihedral to tricky technical crux moves and continue to the top. WARNING: It has been reported (see comments) that the 7th bolt on this climb is missing it's hanger. When someone replaces this hanger, let me know in the comments section so I can remove this warning.
content.protection: Approximately 12 bolts with Mussey's on top
content.location: Second route from the top end of the gorge on the right side as you go upstream. To access the anchors at the bottom of this climb you must either scramble up a 4th class section or lead it with one bolt. In either case locate the bolt approx 20' up the wall and climb past this bolt and traverse left to the anchors . The anchors are approximately 40' above the stream bed.

climbs.name: High and Dry
climbs.fa: Brian Mason, Dave Hatchett, and Curtis Sykes 1990

content.description:
Climb the left side of the leftmost section of bolts on the south wall.  The right side of these bolts is called Dam It (5.11b).

This route feels like being in a gym. There are a bunch of pockets and other solid holds up this face route, and the crux is getting yourself to the first bolt. This route is pretty sustained, though the route itself is quite enjoyable.

The top section is a little scary traversing to the right over to the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor. You can set up a top rope on the bolts by walking around the top of the Gorge over to the bolts.

content.description: Thin face moves leads to better holds with crux near top of route. Stay left and finish at same anchors as Super Alpine route.

This route climbs the right side of the leftmost bolts on the south side of the gorge. Face climbing up excellent slopers and crimps will get you to the top.

Climbing on this route is pretty crowded with the left side of the bolts, which is called Buzz Saw (5.10a).  This route is sustained, especially after the approach hike.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor. To set up a top rope, walk around the gorge to the top anchors above.

content.description: left most route on right side of Wishing Well. Need a 70 meter rope. fun face climbing leads to a crux move pulling small roof. easier climbing leads to anchors.
